column5: yes jaques just the two and live minnows are not allowed in all lakes and personally think that dace are the only live minnows that should be allowed here as they dont disturb and eco system too much. how many lines are you allowed across the creek?   where abouts "up north" you and your son headin DONT GET CAUGHT?

Thanks DGC Wish you and your son the best of luck I'll be keeping an eye out for your report   Here we are allowed 5 lines / tipups per permit and the only zone that we can use live minnows is 25.... the Ottawa river.   All of the other creeks, lakes and rivers dead minnows only  That's OK.... just need a little elbow juice to keep the tipup jigging

well lucky you!!!! i normally use salted minnows any how and only two lines!!! elbows must be hurting at the end of the day, although i have to say that Quebec does have a what i would say is a better fish and wildlife program than here especially wildlife and dont blame them for trying to keep it that way!

Matt, two lines is enough to handle..... heck today, was only able to set 3 of them and could not keep up    as the perch was on fire.... but a lot of hit and miss  There are some wildlife rules that are different in QC from Ont and can just don't understand why it shouldn't be all the same Canada wide

its the days when the bites slow that 5 would be nice! and as for why its not nationwide is because how do u reulate alberta deer numbers to quebec and so on and so forth but ontario is behind the ball on the wildlife aspect for sure in many areas!

Matt what I'd like to see for QC is the group hunting party.... I think that it does not matter who shoots the animal... what counts is the results from a group aspect  Here in QC, once you tag a deer your hunting is over.  We don't even get extra tags like you guys have... if we are lucky, we get a doe tag from a draw.  Enough said about that and lets get back to hard water fishing.... going tomorrow for sure around 9ish if the  winds cooperate  Tight lines J
HEY jaques great to have been out with you and WHITESPINNER!  i was looking for the EYES but they never showed up!   are we still up for tommorow????  the pike are calling my name!
Yes Kev, come on over tomorrow for sure... if Paul don't want to go I will     We should be leaving aroung 9ish

onother great report  man i should come here to look at you guys report more often.  this is where i might head out tomorw morning..if i am not going to the little bay across the river or mc bay.  its so close to my house like..3min.  .  thanks to share those picts/report  joco

Nice one guys (the 3 amigos....lol)  By the looks of it a busy day!   Like Whitespinner bait said in a reply tomy post earlier,lots of perch to keep ya active and warm....but the walleye   Great pics guys   thanks for sharing.   Simon

Joco, if you are going to Leamy I'd recommend that you go towards the beach and setup in the drop off, I'd say about 100' from shore.... that is where I caught all of the perch and it was none stop from the very beginning.   There was about 8' to 15' feet of water and a nice weed bed...  If not McBay is another good area.... Good luck to ya tomorrow
Nice stuff leachman.  Bit chilly but the perch probably helped keep you warm running back and forth.

the beach is the place or one off the place i go wen going to that lake..one other place is on the far right wen looking the lake frome the restaurant...goo place there to...but the beach is usely better.  but to go there and park at the parking you have to go true that channel..not as mutch ice..current in that channel...  remeber that machine that went true 2 yers ago there.?  joco
Thanks Sean.... It sure did

On the far right, the lake is deeper and rocky bottom.... Me and Paul tried last Saturday afternoon but the rain was coming down so hard, we had to leave cause we were soaking wet  I remember that machine that went throught the ice in the channel a couple of years ago..... directly in front of the channel about 150 yards is a good spot..... there is another drop off and is where Paul caught is very first muski, not the biggest but a lot of fun.
What machine was that   ????????????
Skidoo Paul

actualy it was the little machine that you see that clean the sidewalk..made by bonbardier..there heavy.  there were supose to do a rink on leamay lake and change there mind.  .  its was a city worker on a city machine and it went true.but the guy was ok.  was supose to go this morning..but the wind change my mind..  ...plus the wife was ON THE SHOPING MOD...  see you guys soon  joco
Ok then 4 skidoos  Yeah Marco that wind was just insane this morning     Wise decision to go shopping Will see you soon on ice my friend

Well guys the plan was for the three amigos Fishing 24/7, whitespinnerbait and me to go to Lac leamy and try for the elusive walleyes.  Got there at around 9:30am this morning, temperature -16C with 10 Km north east winds and sunny..... just what the doctor ordered  Since it was our first time going this year, as soon as we arrived at our spot on shore we drilled a hole with the auger to check the ice thinkness...... 4" of black and 2" of white..... safe to walk on    and got setup.  Since this lake is in zone 10 and part of the Gatineau river we were only allowed dead minnows.  I was fishing in 8' to 10' fow on top of a weed bed.  As soon as I had my first tipup ready.... I get a hit.... turn around and start to pull in the line only to see a decent perch make a U turn at the top of the hole  Got a couple more tipups setup and it was none stop action, a lot of hit and miss but truly lots of fun.   Took a pic of my tipups and the other two amigos jigging away    A few hit & miss later and I get my first perch.... about 9"    Since the perch was somewhat active, I truly believe that we would hook into some eyes but alas wasn't meant to be  Got into a few more and at around 2:00pm called it a day.... here a few pics            Fishing 24/7 got one jigging    Was great to be out on the ice and had a great time amongst friends Hope you enjoy Jacques aka Leechman

Looks like everyone had a great time,and hey the perch sure do keep you busy !!!   well the weather looked very decent too,maybe the walleyes will come out to play next time !!!! so what time is the perch fry tonight ???  LOL..LOL..
looks like a fun day  cheers!

Hey Jacques...nice to see that you guys got out to enjoy this awesome day!!!....nice perch, but, you got off the Lac to early bud!!!...the walleye are just startin' to bite right about now..4:30PM - 6:00PM

Thanks fishindevil    Them perch were on fire today.... I think I spent more time trying to catch then catching   Thanks lunkerbasshunter    I know Steve.... but Paul had a party to go to and we had to leave     Just before we left, I had a double header on my tipups to deal with    and I got them

Yeah , sure was great to get out on the ice with friends today ,,Even though I slept in  Here is a pic of a crow ripping off one of my minnows     And a pic of the Hotel de Casino de Lac Leamy       Jacques,, maybe tomorrow we will go  back to good old Mcbay .
Thanks Paul for the added pics That's why you were coming back to get minnows all the time  What time you wanna go??  Might be a good idea to go tonight to get fresh minnows at willies

Well Jacques,I got some long awaited days off and you sir have moi, getting the itch to get,er goin. Thanks for sharing your day. Simply a great looking day to be out. Like the tip up line. Makes for no tripping over anything. Good job.
Thanks Brian    was a wonderful day to be out there. Where bout you going fishing in your long awaited days off?

looks like a good day was had by all, -16 is manageable at least and wind out of the east boo! hahah   i'm a firm believer in the westerlies, nice pics good report and what time is dinner becasue i didnt get out today. not that i slept in like some!!!! hahah but never got to bed!
Thanks Matt     WHAT!!!!! you slipped up Well then, I want a report tomorrow prunto  j/k  Was truly a beauty day and lots of fun Jacques

i'll be out fishing tonight again jaques, so i may slip up once more i prefer the monday to friday fishing anyhow less people can steal my tricks if they're watchin me! hahah nothin beter than a day of fishin with good friends!
AH AH AH AH Im not falling for that trick my friend.  I have a few small lakes here I will be getting  out to. You,ll just need to stew and wait for my report.
Cool Matt, I'll expect your report sometime tomorrow   if I go fishing tomorrow morning before the storm... I'll post another report  Tight lines Jacques
No tricks or pun intended Brian..... I'll expect a full report from you in the near future Go get'm tiger    oh I mean misfish Tight lines Jacques
You hit the Jackpot there!!!   Sorry that was meant for the Casino pictures.  Good perch day for sure !!!
Yer too funny bud. You need to polish up on yer knowledge of NEWFIE humor.LOL
u watch jaques brian is gonna have the backround and shorline cloured black with the use of paint when his report comes out! HAHA
Thanks Dan.... some of the amigos were temped to go to the casino because of the lack of bitting I on the other hand hit the jackpot
Hey,it not my fault my cameras crap.LOL
hahahah i know what lake your goin fishin at.   NUNYA lake i fish there often     "where ya goin? nunya lake, where's that? nunya business!"   HAHA
NEWFIE..... WHAT'S THAT  Well then Brian, tell me, what species of fish are you targetting?? and what kind of setup are you going to use??

I,ll be using small shinners. The hook of choice will be,between mini meegs and a yellow jig o whopper. Those will be for jigg,n. Lightly. The other will be a set line with just a split shot and a hook.Oh, and a shinner,,,,,,,,,,LIVE .LOL
Cool Brian. That's right.... you guys only allowed 2 lines, but at least you can use live minnows  Wish you the best of luck and report back ASAP Just can't wait Jacques
Great report Leechman.Looks like fun!    My son and I are heading for north in Feb. for lakers.Can't wait.
